title: 2022 New Orleans Saints season
text:
The <a href="2022%20NFL%20season">2022 season</a> will be the <a href="New%20Orleans%20Saints">New Orleans Saints</a>' 56th in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL), their 47th playing home games at the <a href="Caesars%20Superdome">Caesars Superdome</a> and their first under a new <a href="List%20of%20New%20Orleans%20Saints%20head%20coaches">head coach</a>. They will attempt to improve from their 9–8 season from last year and return to the playoffs from a one-year absence.
Long-time head coach <a href="Sean%20Payton">Sean Payton</a> announced his retirement shortly after the Saints 2021 season ended on January 25, 2022. In his 16 years as head coach, Payton led the Saints to seven <a href="NFC%20South">NFC South</a> titles, nine playoff appearances, and to the franchise's first and only Super Bowl title in <a href="Super%20Bowl%20XLIV">Super Bowl XLIV</a>. Prior to his departure, Payton was also the second-longest active tenured head coach in the NFL, only behind <a href="Bill%20Belichick">Bill Belichick</a> of the <a href="New%20England%20Patriots">New England Patriots</a>.
